etymology.description: 止(止) (zhǐ, "foot") + 止(止) (zhǐ, "foot") = two outstretched feet diverging -> diverging direction
etymology.interpretation: The character 癶(bá) represents two feet moving in opposite directions, symbolizing divergence and movement. It contrasts with 舛(舛) (chuǎn, "contradict"), which depicts convergent feet, highlighting different types of movement orientations.

examples.chinese: 古文字中有癶(古文字中有癶)，象征着两只伸出的脚(象徵著兩隻伸出的腳)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔ wénzì zhōng yǒu bá, xiàngzhēngzhe liǎng zhǐ shēnchū de jiǎo.
examples.english: In ancient scripts, bá appears, symbolizing two outstretched feet.

examples.chinese: 汉字构造中含有癶(漢字構造中含有癶)，展现出足部迅猛伸展的形态(展現出足部迅猛伸展的形態)。
examples.pinyin: Hànzì gòuzào zhōng hányǒu bá, zhǎnxiàn chū zúbù xùnměng shēnzhǎn de xíngtài.
examples.english: Within the structure of Chinese characters, bá is incorporated, revealing the form of swiftly outstretched feet.

examples.chinese: 癶象征着两只外伸的脚(癶象徵著兩隻外伸的腳)。
examples.pinyin: Bá xiàngzhēngzhe liǎng zhǐ wài shēn de jiǎo.
